title: Prompt Basics
excerpt: Learn the fundamental principles of effective AI prompting. Perfect for beginners starting their journey with AI communication.

title: What is a Prompt?
excerpt: A prompt is the text input you send to an AI. Learn how to structure your requests for better AI responses.

title: Anatomy of a Prompt
excerpt: Understand the key components that make up an effective prompt: context, task, format, and constraints.

title: Facts & Fictions
excerpt: Research-backed truths about AI capabilities, prompt engineering, and common misconceptions from MIT, Stanford, Wharton, and government sources.

title: CRISP Method
excerpt: Context, Role, Instructions, Specifics, Parameters. The essential framework for clear, effective prompts.

title: CRISP: Context
excerpt: Set the stage with background information. Help AI understand your situation and what you're trying to achieve.

title: CRISP: Role
excerpt: Define the persona for the AI to adopt. Assign expertise or perspective to shape responses appropriately.

title: CRISP: Instructions
excerpt: Provide specific guidelines for the task. Tell AI exactly what you want it to accomplish.

title: CRISP: Specifics
excerpt: Define format, length, tone, and scope. Add the details that shape how the output should look and sound.

title: CRISP: Parameters
excerpt: Set constraints and boundaries. Define what to include, exclude, or avoid in the response.

title: CRISPE Method
excerpt: CRISP plus Example for few-shot learning. Particularly useful for creative tasks where showing is better than telling.

title: CRISPE: Example
excerpt: Provide examples to show AI the format or style you want. Demonstrations help achieve consistent, patterned outputs.

title: COSTAR Method
excerpt: Context, Objective, Style, Tone, Audience, Response. Ideal for professional content creation with specific voice and audience requirements.

title: COSTAR: Objective
excerpt: Define the specific goal or outcome you want. Be clear about what success looks like.

title: COSTAR: Style
excerpt: Specify the writing style: formal, casual, technical, conversational. Match the content to its purpose.

title: COSTAR: Tone
excerpt: Set the emotional tone: professional, friendly, urgent, encouraging. Shape how the message feels.

title: COSTAR: Audience
excerpt: Identify who will receive the content. Tailor language and complexity to your audience.

title: COSTAR: Response
excerpt: Define the desired response format: list, paragraph, table, JSON. Specify exactly how output should be structured.

title: ReAct Method
excerpt: Reasoning + Acting. For complex tasks requiring transparent, verifiable thinking processes. AI shows its work.

title: ReAct: Reasoning
excerpt: The thinking phase where AI analyzes the problem, considers options, and plans its approach.

title: ReAct: Acting
excerpt: The action phase where AI executes based on its reasoning. Clear connection between thought and action.

title: Flipped Interaction Method
excerpt: Let AI interview you first. Prevent generic advice by having AI ask clarifying questions before responding.

title: Why Flipped Interaction Works
excerpt: AI can't give great advice without understanding your situation. Flipping the interaction ensures relevant, tailored responses.

title: How to Trigger Flipped Interaction
excerpt: Simple prompts like "Before answering, ask me 5 questions to understand my situation better" activate this pattern.

title: Chain-of-Thought Framework
excerpt: Encourage AI to think step-by-step through complex problems. Improves accuracy for math, logic, and analysis.

title: Few-Shot Learning Framework
excerpt: Provide 2-5 examples to help AI understand the pattern you want. More effective than description for complex formats.

title: Role Prompting Framework
excerpt: Assign AI a specific role or persona to shape its responses. Useful for expert knowledge and consistent tone.

title: Constrained Output Framework
excerpt: Define exact output formats, lengths, and structures. Essential for integrating AI outputs into workflows.

title: Self-Consistency Framework
excerpt: Ask AI to solve problems multiple ways and compare. Helps catch errors and improve accuracy.

title: Prompt Chaining Framework
excerpt: Break complex tasks into sequential prompts where each builds on previous outputs. Essential for complex workflows.

title: Discover Frameworks
excerpt: Browse 62+ prompt engineering frameworks organized by category. Structured templates, reasoning techniques, decomposition methods, and more.

title: Structured Frameworks
excerpt: Browse 5 structured prompt engineering frameworks: CRISP, CRISPE, COSTAR, Context and Structure, and Constrained Output. Step-by-step templates for clear, repeatable prompts.

title: Reasoning and CoT
excerpt: Explore 14 chain-of-thought and reasoning frameworks for prompt engineering. From basic CoT to Analogical Reasoning, Step-Back, and Memory of Thought.

title: Decomposition
excerpt: Explore 7 decomposition frameworks for breaking complex problems into manageable parts. Includes Least-to-Most, Tree of Thought, Graph of Thought, and more.

title: Self-Correction
excerpt: Explore 7 self-correction frameworks that enable AI to critique, verify, and refine its own outputs. Includes Self-Refine, CRITIC, Reflexion, and more.

title: In-Context Learning
excerpt: Explore 9 in-context learning frameworks: Few-Shot, Zero-Shot, One-Shot, Example Selection, KNN Prompting, and more. Teach AI by demonstration.

title: Ensemble Methods
excerpt: Explore 7 ensemble prompting frameworks: Self-Consistency, COSP, DiVeRSe, Dense Prompting, and more. Combine multiple outputs for reliable results.

title: Prompting Strategies
excerpt: Explore 11 versatile prompting strategies: ReAct, Role Prompting, Emotion Prompting, Prompt Chaining, S2A, SimToM, and more. Shape how AI approaches tasks.

title: Prompt Analyzer
excerpt: Analyze your prompts against CRISP, COSTAR, and CRISPE frameworks. Get scores and suggestions for improvement.

title: Prompt Builder
excerpt: Build structured prompts step-by-step with guided questions. Choose your framework and get a ready-to-use prompt.

title: Method Matcher
excerpt: Describe your task and get a recommendation for which prompting method to use. Find the right framework for your needs.

title: Preflight Checklist
excerpt: Review your prompt before sending. Check for context, clarity, specificity, and potential issues.

title: Hallucination Spotter
excerpt: Practice identifying AI hallucinations. Learn to spot fake citations, invented facts, and fabricated information.

title: Persona Architect
excerpt: Design custom AI personas with sliders for expertise, tone, detail level, and creativity. Generate ready-to-use role prompts.

title: AI Readiness Quiz
excerpt: 40 questions across 4 levels: Good, Pro, Expert, Master. Test your AI prompting knowledge from basics to advanced.

title: Chain of Thought Pattern
excerpt: Encourage step-by-step reasoning by asking AI to "think through" problems before answering. Best for math, logic, debugging.

title: Few-Shot Learning Pattern
excerpt: Provide 2-5 examples of the input-output format you want before your actual request. Best for consistent formatting.

title: Role Prompting Pattern
excerpt: Assign AI a specific role or expertise to shape its responses and vocabulary. Best for technical writing and specialized content.

title: Structured Output Pattern
excerpt: Define the exact format you want (JSON, table, outline) before the request. Best for data extraction and consistent reports.

title: Self-Consistency Pattern
excerpt: Ask AI to verify its own work or approach a problem multiple ways and compare. Best for math and fact-checking.

title: Prompt Chaining Pattern
excerpt: Break complex tasks into sequential prompts where each output feeds the next input. Best for long documents and research.

title: Devil's Advocate Pattern
excerpt: Ask AI to argue against a position or find weaknesses in an idea. Best for decision making and risk assessment.

title: Constraints First Pattern
excerpt: State limitations and requirements before the main request to frame the response. Best for length control and audience targeting.

title: Flipped Interaction Pattern
excerpt: Ask AI to interview you first before giving advice. Prevents generic responses. Best for personalized advice and strategic planning.

title: What is a prompt?
excerpt: A prompt is the text you send to an AI assistant. It can be a question, instruction, request, or any combination.

title: Which AI should I use?
excerpt: The techniques taught here work with any modern AI assistant. Each has different strengths, but prompting fundamentals are universal.

title: Do I need technical skills?
excerpt: No. AI assistants understand natural language. You don't need coding skills or technical knowledge—just clear communication.

title: Where should I start learning?
excerpt: Start with Prompt Basics to understand core concepts, then move to CRISP Method as your first framework.

title: Which prompting method should I use?
excerpt: CRISP for everyday tasks, CRISPE for creative work with examples, COSTAR for professional content, ReAct for complex problems.

title: Do I have to memorize these frameworks?
excerpt: No. Frameworks are learning tools. Once you internalize the concepts, you'll naturally include the right details without following a structure.

title: Can I combine different methods?
excerpt: Absolutely. The methods aren't rigid rules—they're guidelines. Take elements from different frameworks based on what your task needs.

title: What's the difference between CRISP and CRISPE?
excerpt: CRISPE adds an "Example" component for few-shot learning. Useful for creative tasks where showing examples is more effective than describing.

title: What is a hallucination?
excerpt: When AI generates plausible but incorrect or made-up information. Includes fake citations, invented statistics, and fictional events.

title: Can I trust AI for medical, legal, or financial advice?
excerpt: No. AI should never replace professional advice in high-stakes domains. Use it to prepare questions, but critical decisions require qualified human professionals.

title: Is my data safe when using AI?
excerpt: Assume anything you type could be stored or used for training. Never share passwords, personal identifiers, or confidential business information.

title: Why does AI sometimes give wrong answers confidently?
excerpt: AI predicts likely text patterns—it doesn't "know" things like humans. When it lacks information, it doesn't have uncertainty signals. Verification is essential.

title: Is Praxis really free?
excerpt: Yes, completely free. No account required, no premium tiers, no ads, no tracking. AI skills should be accessible to everyone.

title: Does this site use AI?
excerpt: Absolutely! The content and tools were developed with AI assistants. But interactive tools work locally—nothing you type is transmitted anywhere.

title: Who created Praxis?
excerpt: Praxis was created by Basiliso Rosario with the mission of demystifying AI and making effective prompting skills accessible to everyone.

excerpt: Our mission to make AI literacy accessible to everyone regardless of background, ability, or experience level.

excerpt: How Praxis implements Universal Design and Universal Design for Learning principles for accessible education.

excerpt: Technical breakdown of how Praxis achieves 100% Lighthouse performance through zero dependencies and optimization.

excerpt: How Praxis was built with Claude Code - demonstrating practical human-AI collaboration in software development.

excerpt: Key terms and concepts for understanding AI and effective prompting. Your reference for AI terminology.

title: Frequently Asked Questions
excerpt: Common questions about AI, prompting, and getting the most from this resource. Find answers quickly.

title: Prompt Patterns Library
excerpt: Reusable frameworks for common tasks. Patterns to understand and adapt, not templates to copy.

title: Many-Shot Prompting
excerpt: Provide dozens to thousands of demonstrations within the prompt, leveraging extended context windows to teach complex patterns through volume of examples.

title: Example Ordering
excerpt: Optimize the sequence of few-shot demonstrations to maximize model performance. The same examples in different orders can swing accuracy by 20+ percentage points.

title: Self-Generated ICL
excerpt: Have the model generate its own few-shot examples before tackling the actual task, eliminating the need for manually curated demonstrations.

title: Active Example Selection
excerpt: Dynamically choose few-shot demonstrations based on model uncertainty for each specific query, providing targeted examples where the model needs them most.

title: Uncertainty-Routed CoT
excerpt: Conditionally apply chain-of-thought reasoning only when the model is uncertain, saving tokens on easy questions while maintaining accuracy on hard ones.

title: Image Prompting Basics
excerpt: Foundational techniques for prompting AI models to understand, analyze, describe, and reason about images in multimodal contexts.

title: Multimodal Chain of Thought
excerpt: Extend chain-of-thought reasoning to combine visual and textual information, generating rationales that incorporate both modalities before producing answers.

title: Visual Chain of Thought
excerpt: Guide AI models through step-by-step visual reasoning by explicitly referencing and analyzing image regions in sequence.

title: Image-as-Text Prompting
excerpt: Convert visual information into structured text descriptions to enable text-only models to reason about image content effectively.

title: Visual Question Answering
excerpt: Techniques for asking precise questions about images and getting accurate, grounded answers from multimodal AI models.

title: Image Generation Prompting
excerpt: Master the art of crafting text prompts that produce high-quality, accurate AI-generated images through structured description techniques.

title: Negative Prompting
excerpt: Specify what to exclude from AI-generated images to improve quality, avoid artifacts, and control output more precisely.

title: ControlNet Prompting
excerpt: Use structural conditioning inputs like edge maps, depth maps, and pose skeletons to precisely control AI image generation beyond text prompts alone.

title: Inpainting Prompting
excerpt: Guide AI to selectively edit, replace, or restore specific regions within existing images while preserving surrounding context.

title: Style Transfer Prompting
excerpt: Apply artistic styles, visual aesthetics, and design languages to AI-generated or existing images through carefully crafted prompts.

title: Image-to-Image Prompting
excerpt: Transform existing images using AI by combining reference images with text prompts to control style, content, and transformation strength.

title: Composition Prompting
excerpt: Control the spatial arrangement, framing, and visual hierarchy of AI-generated images through structured compositional instructions.

title: Audio Prompting Basics
excerpt: Foundational techniques for guiding AI models to understand, transcribe, analyze, and reason about audio inputs.

title: Speech-to-Text Prompting
excerpt: Techniques for controlling how speech is transcribed into structured, formatted text with speaker attribution and domain vocabulary.

title: Text-to-Speech Prompting
excerpt: Methods for controlling voice synthesis including speaking style, emotion, pacing, and pronunciation through text instructions.

title: Audio Classification
excerpt: Prompt-based techniques for categorizing audio by genre, emotion, speaker identity, environment, and event detection.

title: Music Generation Prompting
excerpt: Techniques for translating musical intent into natural language prompts that AI models use to generate audio compositions.

title: Voice Cloning Prompting
excerpt: Methods for combining reference audio with text instructions to reproduce specific voice characteristics for new content.

title: Video Prompting Basics
excerpt: Foundational techniques for guiding AI models to analyze, understand, and reason about video content including temporal sequences and motion.

title: Video Generation Prompting
excerpt: Techniques for crafting prompts that guide AI models to create, synthesize, and produce video content from textual descriptions.

title: Temporal Reasoning
excerpt: Techniques for prompting AI models to understand, analyze, and reason about events across time in video content.

title: Video QA
excerpt: Techniques for prompting AI models to answer specific questions about video content, combining visual understanding with temporal reasoning.

title: Video Captioning
excerpt: Techniques for prompting AI models to generate accurate, descriptive captions and text descriptions for video content.

title: Video Editing Prompting
excerpt: Techniques for using AI to modify, transform, and enhance existing video content through natural language instructions.

title: Program Synthesis
excerpt: Techniques for guiding AI models to generate complete, functional programs from high-level specifications and input-output examples.

title: Code Explanation
excerpt: Techniques for prompting AI models to analyze, interpret, and explain existing code at multiple levels of abstraction.

title: Code Review Prompting
excerpt: Techniques for guiding AI models to perform systematic code reviews covering security, performance, and maintainability.

title: Test Generation
excerpt: Techniques for prompting AI models to create comprehensive test suites including unit tests, integration tests, and edge case coverage.

title: SQL Generation
excerpt: Techniques for prompting AI models to translate natural language questions into accurate, optimized SQL queries.

title: Modality Frameworks
excerpt: Hub page for all modality-specific prompting frameworks: image, audio, video, code, and 3D content techniques.

title: 3D Prompting Basics
excerpt: Foundational techniques for guiding AI models to understand, generate, and reason about three-dimensional spatial data.

title: 3D Model Generation
excerpt: Techniques for prompting AI systems to create three-dimensional models, meshes, and objects from text descriptions.

title: Scene Understanding
excerpt: Techniques for prompting AI to analyze complete 3D scenes including spatial relationships, object placement, and environmental context.

title: Pose Estimation Prompting
excerpt: Techniques for guiding AI models to detect, analyze, and reason about human body poses and skeletal configurations.

title: Point Cloud Prompting
excerpt: Techniques for guiding AI models to process, analyze, and reason about 3D point cloud data from LiDAR and depth sensors.

title: Active Prompting
excerpt: Active Prompting: Identify the model's most uncertain questions and focus chain-of-thought annotation effort where it matters most for improved reasoning performance.

title: Analogical Reasoning
excerpt: Analogical Reasoning: Have the AI self-generate relevant examples and analogies from its training to solve novel problems — no manual demonstrations needed.

title: Auto-CoT
excerpt: Auto-CoT: Automatically generate diverse Chain-of-Thought demonstrations through question clustering — no manual examples needed.

title: Complexity-Based Prompting
excerpt: Complexity-Based Prompting: Enhance Self-Consistency by weighting reasoning chains by their complexity — longer, more thorough chains get more influence.

title: Contrastive Chain-of-Thought
excerpt: Contrastive Chain-of-Thought: Show both correct and incorrect reasoning to help AI distinguish good from bad reasoning patterns.

title: Faithful Chain-of-Thought
excerpt: Faithful Chain-of-Thought: Ground every reasoning step in verifiable logic using symbolic computation to ensure the chain actually determines the answer.

title: Memory of Thought
excerpt: Memory of Thought: Store the model's own successful reasoning chains and retrieve them as demonstrations for new problems — turning past performance into future guidance.

title: Reversing Chain-of-Thought
excerpt: Reversing Chain-of-Thought: Verify forward reasoning by working backwards from conclusion to premises, catching errors that forward-only reasoning misses.

title: Step-Back Prompting
excerpt: Step-Back Prompting: Abstract to high-level principles before answering specific questions — grounding responses in foundational knowledge for better reasoning.

title: Structured Chain-of-Thought
excerpt: Structured Chain-of-Thought: Enforce specific reasoning templates and formats for consistent, verifiable AI outputs.

title: Tab-CoT (Tabular Chain-of-Thought)
excerpt: Tab-CoT (Tabular Chain-of-Thought): Format AI reasoning into structured tables with explicit columns for step, operation, input, output, and reasoning.

title: Thread of Thought
excerpt: Thread of Thought (ThoT): Guide AI through chaotic, lengthy contexts by walking through the information systematically before answering — taming information overload.

title: Tree of Thought
excerpt: Tree of Thought: Explore multiple reasoning paths as a tree structure, evaluate branches, and prune dead ends for complex problem-solving with LLMs.

title: Zero-Shot Chain-of-Thought
excerpt: Zero-Shot Chain-of-Thought: Unlock AI reasoning with a simple trigger phrase. Add 'Let's think step by step' to any prompt for dramatically improved accuracy without examples.

title: Chain-of-Verification
excerpt: Chain-of-Verification: Generate answers, create verification questions, answer them, and revise based on discovered inconsistencies.

title: Decomposed Prompting (DecomP)
excerpt: Decomposed Prompting (DecomP): Break complex tasks into specialized sub-procedures, routing each sub-problem to its ideal solver for maximum accuracy.

title: Graph of Thoughts
excerpt: Graph of Thoughts (GoT): Model reasoning as a graph structure where thoughts can branch, merge, loop, and form complex networks for superior problem-solving.

title: Least-to-Most Prompting
excerpt: Least-to-Most Prompting: Break complex problems into simpler sub-problems, solve them progressively from easiest to hardest, and build toward the final answer systematically.

title: Plan-and-Solve Prompting
excerpt: Plan-and-Solve Prompting: A two-phase zero-shot technique that first devises a plan then executes it step by step for improved multi-step reasoning.

title: Program of Thoughts (PoT)
excerpt: Program of Thoughts (PoT): Instead of reasoning in natural language, generate executable code that represents the reasoning steps. A code interpreter then runs the program to produce exact answers.

title: Recursion of Thought
excerpt: Recursion of Thought: Apply recursive divide-and-conquer reasoning to decompose complex problems into sub-problems until reaching solvable base cases.

title: CRITIC
excerpt: CRITIC: Have LLMs critique and verify their own outputs using external tools and structured feedback.

title: Cumulative Reasoning
excerpt: Cumulative Reasoning: Build answers one verified proposition at a time using a three-module architecture of Proposer, Verifier, and Reporter.

title: Reflexion
excerpt: Reflexion: Learn from failures by reflecting on mistakes and storing insights in memory for future attempts.

title: Self-Calibration
excerpt: Self-Calibration: Have the model assess its own confidence to know when to trust its answers.

title: Self-Refine
excerpt: Self-Refine: Iterative improvement where AI generates, critiques, and refines its own outputs for higher quality results.

title: Self-Verification
excerpt: Self-Verification: Have AI validate its own answers through systematic checking, backward reasoning, and constraint validation.

title: COSP
excerpt: COSP: Consistency-based Self-adaptive Prompting — automatically generate reliable demonstrations from the model's own consistent outputs without human labeling.

title: Dense Prompting
excerpt: Dense Prompting: Learn how comprehensive, information-rich prompts with structured context, constraints, examples, and quality criteria reduce ambiguity and improve AI output quality.

title: DiVeRSe Prompting
excerpt: DiVeRSe Prompting: Combine diverse reasoning paths with step-by-step verification scoring to produce more reliable answers through verified ensemble voting.

title: Max Mutual Information
excerpt: Max Mutual Information: Select few-shot examples that maximize the information connection between demonstrations and the desired output — choosing examples by predictive power, not surface similarity.

title: Meta-Reasoning Prompting
excerpt: Meta-Reasoning Prompting: Have the AI select the best reasoning strategy for each problem before solving it — matching technique to task for optimal results.

title: Universal Self-Consistency
excerpt: Universal Self-Consistency: Extend consistency-based voting beyond fixed answers to free-form generation — let the model itself judge which response best represents the consensus across multiple samples.

title: Demonstration Ensembling
excerpt: Demonstration Ensembling: Run the same query with multiple different sets of few-shot examples and combine results through voting or aggregation for more robust, consistent AI predictions.

title: Example Selection
excerpt: Example Selection: Learn how choosing the right few-shot demonstrations can improve AI performance by 20-30% over random selection through similarity-based, diversity-based, and task-specific strategies.

title: KNN Prompting
excerpt: KNN Prompting: Dynamically select the most relevant few-shot examples using nearest-neighbor retrieval for improved in-context learning performance.

title: One-Shot Learning
excerpt: One-Shot Learning: Teach AI new tasks with a single example. The sweet spot between zero-shot and few-shot prompting for efficient, format-accurate responses.

title: Prompt Mining
excerpt: Prompt Mining: Automatically discover effective prompt templates by systematically searching through candidate phrasings, evaluating performance, and surfacing optimal formulations that humans would never think to try.

title: Vote-K Prompting
excerpt: Vote-K Prompting: Let the model vote on which unlabeled examples would be most valuable to annotate, focusing human effort on the most impactful demonstrations.

title: Zero-Shot Prompting
excerpt: Zero-Shot Prompting: The foundational technique for getting AI to perform tasks without any examples, relying entirely on clear instructions and pre-trained knowledge.

title: Emotion Prompting
excerpt: Emotion Prompting: Add emotional stakes, urgency, or psychological framing to prompts to activate more thorough, higher-quality AI responses.

title: Rephrase and Respond (RaR)
excerpt: Rephrase and Respond (RaR): Have AI rephrase your question before answering to surface ambiguities, improve comprehension, and produce more accurate responses.

title: RE2 (Re-Reading)
excerpt: RE2 (Re-Reading): A simple yet effective technique that includes the question twice in the prompt for deeper comprehension and more accurate AI responses.

title: System 2 Attention (S2A)
excerpt: System 2 Attention (S2A): Filter distracting or biasing information from context before reasoning for more objective, focused AI responses.

title: Self-Ask Prompting
excerpt: Self-Ask Prompting: Have AI decompose complex questions by explicitly asking and answering intermediate sub-questions for transparent multi-hop reasoning.

title: SimToM
excerpt: SimToM: Simulate Theory of Mind by filtering context to each person's perspective — answer questions based on what specific individuals know, not everything you know.

title: Style Prompting
excerpt: Style Prompting: Control the tone, formality, and writing voice of AI outputs through explicit style instructions that separate content from delivery.

title: Context Structure
excerpt: Context Structure: Learn how organizing, ordering, and delimiting information in prompts dramatically affects LLM comprehension, accuracy, and output quality.

title: Code Prompting
excerpt: Code Prompting: Strategies for effective code generation, explanation, transformation, and review using AI language models.

title: Self-Debugging
excerpt: Self-Debugging: AI-assisted bug identification and fixing strategies for generated or existing code.

title: Structured Output
excerpt: Structured Output: Techniques for generating reliable JSON, XML, YAML, and other data formats from AI language models.

title: AI Tools for Every Mind
excerpt: AI Tools for Neurodivergent Minds - Practical AI strategies for ADHD, Autism, Dyslexia, and more. Prompting techniques, tool recommendations, and real-world applications.

title: AI for ADHD
excerpt: AI for ADHD - Practical prompting strategies for task management, focus, time blindness, and executive function. Copy-paste prompts that actually work.

title: AI for Autism
excerpt: AI for Autism - Communication scripts, tone checking, social navigation, and routine management prompts. AI as your social communication co-pilot.

title: AI for Dyslexia
excerpt: AI for Dyslexia - Reading assistance, writing support, summarization, and text processing prompts. Turn AI into your literacy co-pilot.

title: AI Tools Finder
excerpt: AI Tools Finder for Neurodivergent Users - Find the right AI tools for ADHD, Autism, Dyslexia, and more. Organized by challenge type with practical recommendations.

title: AI Resources for Neurodivergent Users
excerpt: Curated AI Resources for Neurodivergent Users - Research, organizations, tools, and guides for using AI with ADHD, Autism, Dyslexia, and more.

title: System Prompting
excerpt: System Prompting: Define AI behavior, personality, and constraints through structured system-level instructions that shape every response in a conversation.

title: Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG)
excerpt: Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG): Ground AI responses in real, retrieved documents to reduce hallucination and deliver accurate, source-backed answers.

title: Agentic Prompting
excerpt: Agentic Prompting: Design AI systems that autonomously plan, execute, and adapt multi-step tasks using tools, memory, and reasoning loops.

title: DSPy
excerpt: DSPy: Program language models with typed signatures and automatic compilation instead of hand-crafted prompts. Build modular, optimizable AI pipelines.

title: MIPRO
excerpt: MIPRO: Multi-prompt Instruction Proposal Optimizer that uses bootstrapped traces and Bayesian search to find optimal per-stage instructions for LM programs.

title: AgentFlow
excerpt: AgentFlow & Flow-GRPO: Optimize multi-turn agentic systems in-the-flow with group refined policy optimization for credit assignment across long trajectories.

title: Skeleton-of-Thought
excerpt: Skeleton-of-Thought: Accelerate AI responses by generating an answer outline first, then expanding each point in parallel for faster, more structured outputs.

title: Algorithm of Thoughts (AoT)
excerpt: Algorithm of Thoughts (AoT): Embed algorithmic thinking patterns like DFS and BFS directly into prompts for efficient, structured solution-space exploration in a single inference call.

title: Buffer of Thoughts (BoT)
excerpt: Buffer of Thoughts (BoT): Maintain reusable thought-templates from past problem-solving, achieving 11-51% improvements on reasoning benchmarks through template-guided reasoning.

title: Maieutic Prompting
excerpt: Maieutic Prompting: Build a tree of recursive explanations and use logical consistency to extract reliable commonsense reasoning from language models.

title: Scratchpad Prompting
excerpt: Scratchpad Prompting: Instruct AI models to show intermediate computation steps in a dedicated workspace before producing final answers, improving accuracy on multi-step problems.

title: Selection-Inference (SI)
excerpt: Selection-Inference: Alternate between selecting relevant premises and drawing conclusions to achieve structured, auditable logical reasoning.

title: Thought Propagation
excerpt: Thought Propagation: Solve analogous problems first, then propagate insights and solutions to refine the answer to the target problem.

title: Chain-of-Symbol Prompting (CoS)
excerpt: Chain-of-Symbol: Replace natural language with compact symbolic representations for spatial and structural reasoning, improving accuracy by up to 60%.

title: Symbolic Chain-of-Thought (SymbCoT)
excerpt: Symbolic CoT: Integrate formal logic rules and symbolic expressions with natural language reasoning for verifiable, rigorous chain-of-thought inference.

title: Dual Process Prompting
excerpt: Dual Process Prompting: Route between fast intuitive responses and slow deliberate reasoning based on task complexity, inspired by cognitive science.

title: Chain of Knowledge (CoK)
excerpt: Chain of Knowledge: Generate structured evidence triples with explanation hints for transparent, verifiable reasoning that reduces logical errors.

title: Chain of Abstraction (CoA)
excerpt: Chain of Abstraction: Reason with abstract placeholders first, then fill in concrete values using domain tools for cleaner reasoning and parallel execution.

title: Everything of Thoughts (XoT)
excerpt: Everything of Thoughts (XoT): Combine reinforcement learning and Monte Carlo Tree Search for flexible, efficient reasoning that resolves the performance-efficiency-flexibility trilemma.

title: Branch-Solve-Merge (BSM)
excerpt: Branch-Solve-Merge: Decompose complex tasks into parallel branches, solve each independently, then merge results into a coherent final answer.

title: Successive Prompting
excerpt: Successive Prompting: Decompose complex questions into a sequence of simpler sub-questions, answering each before proceeding to the next.

title: Chain of Table
excerpt: Chain of Table: Transform and reason over tabular data through step-by-step table operations for verifiable data analysis.

title: STaR (Self-Taught Reasoner)
excerpt: STaR: Bootstrap reasoning ability by iteratively generating rationales, filtering for correct ones, and fine-tuning on successful reasoning chains.

title: Quiet-STaR
excerpt: Quiet-STaR: Train language models to generate internal reasoning at every token, learning to think before speaking for improved prediction.

title: Verify-and-Edit
excerpt: Verify-and-Edit: Generate an initial answer, verify each reasoning step, then edit the chain to fix mistakes before the final answer.

title: Progressive-Hint Prompting (PHP)
excerpt: Progressive-Hint Prompting: Iteratively provide the model with its own previous answers as hints, refining toward the correct solution.

title: Mixture of Experts Prompting
excerpt: Mixture of Experts Prompting: Assign multiple expert personas to analyze a problem from diverse perspectives, then synthesize insights.

title: Multi-Expert Prompting
excerpt: Multi-Expert Prompting: Generate answers from multiple simulated experts with structured discussion and voting for higher accuracy.

title: Debate Prompting
excerpt: Debate Prompting: Have agents argue opposing positions, then judge the debate to extract the most well-supported answer.

title: Exchange-of-Thought (EoT)
excerpt: Exchange-of-Thought: Multiple reasoning agents share intermediate thoughts for collaborative problem-solving.

title: Pairwise Evaluation
excerpt: Pairwise Evaluation: Compare outputs in pairs for more consistent and reliable evaluation than absolute scoring.

title: Meta Prompting
excerpt: Meta Prompting: High-level structural templates that teach HOW to approach tasks rather than providing specific content.

title: Batch Prompting
excerpt: Batch Prompting: Process multiple task instances in a single prompt for efficiency and cost reduction.

title: Prompt Repetition
excerpt: Prompt Repetition: Repeating key instructions improves non-reasoning LLM performance through emphasis effects.

title: Directional Stimulus Prompting
excerpt: Directional Stimulus Prompting: Use targeted hints and cues to steer LLM outputs toward desired directions.

title: Generated Knowledge Prompting
excerpt: Generated Knowledge Prompting: Model generates relevant knowledge before answering to improve accuracy.

title: HyDE (Hypothetical Document Embeddings)
excerpt: HyDE: Generate hypothetical answer documents to improve retrieval without task-specific training.

title: Ask Me Anything Prompting
excerpt: Ask Me Anything: Transform task inputs into question-answer format and aggregate multiple reformulated responses.

title: Socratic Prompting
excerpt: Socratic Prompting: Use reflective Socratic questioning to guide AI through iterative reasoning and discovery.

title: Dialogue-Guided Prompting
excerpt: Dialogue-Guided Prompting: Use multi-turn dialogue structure to guide reasoning through conversational exchange.

title: Instruction Induction
excerpt: Instruction Induction: Infer task instructions from a few input-output demonstrations automatically.

title: APE (Automatic Prompt Engineer)
excerpt: APE: Automatically generate and select optimal prompt instructions via LLM-driven search.

title: OPRO (Optimization by Prompting)
excerpt: OPRO: Use LLMs as optimizers where the optimization task is described in natural language.

title: Prompt Paraphrasing
excerpt: Prompt Paraphrasing: Generate multiple semantically similar prompt variants and ensemble their responses.

title: Reasoning via Planning (RAP)
excerpt: Reasoning via Planning: Treat reasoning as planning using the LLM as both world model and agent with MCTS.

title: LATS (Language Agent Tree Search)
excerpt: LATS: Synergize reasoning, acting, and planning via Monte Carlo Tree Search for agents.

title: Chain of Density
excerpt: Chain of Density: Iteratively refine summaries to be progressively more entity-dense without increasing length.

title: Chain of Code
excerpt: Chain of Code: Interweave code execution with LM simulation for reasoning across executable and semantic tasks.

title: PAL (Program-Aided Language Models)
excerpt: PAL: Generate Python programs as reasoning steps and offload execution to an interpreter for accuracy.

title: LMQL (Language Model Query Language)
excerpt: LMQL: SQL-like query language for structured, constrained interaction with language models.

title: Constitutional AI
excerpt: Constitutional AI: Use a set of principles to guide AI self-critique and revision without human feedback.

title: DPO (Direct Preference Optimization)
excerpt: DPO: Simpler alternative to RLHF that directly optimizes model policy from preference data.

title: Instruction Hierarchy
excerpt: Instruction Hierarchy: Define priority levels for conflicting instructions to prevent prompt injection.

title: RACE Framework
excerpt: RACE: Four-component framework defining role, task, context, and expected output format.

title: RISEN Framework
excerpt: RISEN: Five-component framework with built-in step sequencing and scope narrowing.

title: ICIO Framework
excerpt: ICIO: Four-part framework emphasizing clear data input and output specification.

title: CREATE Framework
excerpt: CREATE: Six-component framework with persona adoption, examples, and iterative adjustments.

title: GRADE Framework
excerpt: GRADE: Five-element framework ensuring clear objectives with illustrative examples.

title: SPARK Framework
excerpt: SPARK: Narrative-driven framework for creative problem-solving with a serendipity element.

title: TRACE Framework
excerpt: TRACE: Five-component framework with task clarity and contextual grounding.

title: CARE Framework
excerpt: CARE: Context-aware framework from Nielsen Norman Group with role assignment and expected outcomes.

title: RODES Framework
excerpt: RODES: Five-part framework with built-in output validation through sense checking.

title: BORE Framework
excerpt: BORE: Four-component framework emphasizing background context and measurable expectations.

title: APE Framework (Action, Purpose, Expectation)
excerpt: APE Framework: Beginner-friendly three-part framework for quick, clear prompts.

title: ERA Framework
excerpt: ERA: Three-element framework prioritizing expected outcomes before role and action.

title: RTF Framework
excerpt: RTF: Minimalist three-part framework for persona, task, and output format.

title: TAG Framework
excerpt: TAG: Goal-oriented three-element framework clarifying what, how, and why.

title: BAB Framework
excerpt: BAB: Narrative framework describing current state, desired state, and solution path.

title: BROKE Framework
excerpt: BROKE: Five-component framework combining OKR methodology with prompt engineering.

title: ROSES Framework
excerpt: ROSES: Five-component framework emphasizing scenario context and step-by-step guidance.

title: CAPE Framework
excerpt: CAPE: Educational framework integrating chain-of-thought into structured prompting.

title: SMART Prompting Framework
excerpt: SMART: Goal-setting framework adapted for AI prompting from project management methodology.

title: SCOPE Framework
excerpt: SCOPE: Self-optimizing agent prompt evolution framework for autonomous refinement.

title: MASTER Prompt Method
excerpt: MASTER: Living document meta-framework providing comprehensive organizational context to AI.
